newsitem.title: UK: Brazilian borrowers line up to issue Eurobonds.
newsitem.headline: Brazilian borrowers line up to issue Eurobonds.

text.p: A number of Brazilian borrowers were due to launch Eurobonds this week in dollars and lira, syndicate managers said on Monday.
Banco Bradesco was planning a $100 million three-year Eurobond via J.P. Morgan. Spread talk was around 200 basis points over U.S. Treasury notes.

Banco Cidade was due to issue a $75 million eight-year deal with put and call options at three and five years via Deutsche Morgan Grenfell. Spread talk was in the low-400s b.p. over U.S. Treasuries to the put, dealers said.

Ford Brazil was preparing a $200 million 10-year bond with put and call options at six and eight years via ABN AMRO Hoare Govett and Deutsche Morgan Grenfell. Spread talk was in the high-200s b.p. over to the put.
Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES) will launch a 300 billion lire five-year Eurobond via Credito Italiano, Merrill Lynch and Paribas Capital Markets.
Roadshows for the deal will be held in Switzerland and Italy on Monday and Tuesday.
